did.abstract: One scrapbook, one logbook, and loose correspondence and clippings relating to reunions and activities of the "Old Crowd," an alumni organization of Public School No. 3 in Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The loose correspondence and clippings are housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement. The folder is housed in a single flat box along with the two bound volumes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Old Crowd of Brooklyn Public School No. 3 reunion collection, 1978.118, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, loose clippings from the scrapbook were photocopied and the originals discarded.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Dale F. Oliver ephemera collection (2012.010) contains a 1929 autograph book from P.S. 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One scrapbook, one logbook, and loose correspondence and clippings relating to reunions and activities of the "Old Crowd," an alumni organization of Public School No. 3 located at Hancock Street and Bedford Avenue in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. The logbook contains a listing of the members of the classes of 1892 and 1893 and the reunions they attended. The scrapbook contains graduation programs, reunion dinner programs, clippings, and group photographs. The loose correspondence is between P.S. 3 alumni regarding class reunions during the 1940s.
